poem:
**In Memory of a Designer**

In the theater of ink—  
a world molded by strokes  
and curves, he carved  
007 from the void;  
letters like silhouettes,  
shadows of fiction.  
Posters blossomed  
under his quiet hand,  
etching film dreams  
into the papery air.  
Now, only the whispers  
of his logos linger on—  
a legacy of line.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Joe Caroff, designer of James Bond 007 logo and countless iconic film posters, dies aged 103 The graphic designer responsible for the 007 gun logo as well as countless classic film posters has died, aged 103. Joe Caroff, whose work can be seen on the posters for films including West Side Story, A Hard Day’s Night, Last Tango in Paris, Cabaret, Manhattan and The Last Temptation of Christ, died on Sunday. His sons, Peter and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
